definitions.definition: any of several beetles whose larvae bore holes in dead or dying trees especially conifers
one who is employed to saw wood
fine particles of wood made by sawing wood
cut short
examples: a sawed-off shotgun
a sawed-off broomstick

definitions.definition: well below average height
a member of a Germanic people who conquered England and merged with the Angles and Jutes to become Anglo-Saxons; dominant in England until the Norman Conquest
of or relating to or characteristic of the early Saxons or Anglo-Saxons and their descendents (especially the English or Lowland Scots) and their language
a contagious skin infection caused by the itch mite; characterized by persistent itching and skin irritation
any of various plants of the genus Scabiosa
a variable quantity that cannot be resolved into components
of or relating to a musical scale
examples: he played some basic scalar patterns on his guitar

definitions.definition: of or relating to a directionless magnitude (such as mass or speed etc.) that is completely specified by its magnitude
examples: scalar quantity

definitions.definition: one who is playfully mischievous
a deceitful and unreliable scoundrel
a white Southerner who supported Reconstruction policies after the American Civil War (usually for self-interest)
destitute of scales
an upright in house framing
collect discarded material
examples: She scavenged the garbage cans for food

definitions.definition: remove unwanted substances from
clean refuse from
feed on carrion or refuse
examples: hyenas scavenge

definitions.definition: an outline or synopsis of a play (or, by extension, of a literary work)
a postulated sequence of possible events
examples: planners developed several scenarios in case of an attack

definitions.definition: a setting for a work of art or literature
examples: the scenario is France during the Reign of Terror

definitions.definition: give conventional form to
examples: some art forms schematise designs into geometrical patterns

definitions.definition: acting with a specific goal
concealing crafty designs for advancing your own interest
examples: a scheming wife
a scheming gold digger

definitions.definition: of or relating to or involved in or characteristic of schism
examples: schismatic sects

definitions.definition: of or relating to or characteristic of schizophrenia
characterized by symptoms similar to but less severe than schizophrenia
marked by withdrawal and inability to form close relationships
(Yiddish) a very unlucky or inept person who fails at everything
talk idly or casually and in a friendly way
an informal conversation
United States composer (born in Austria) and pianist noted for his interpretations of the works of Mozart and Beethoven and Schubert (1882-1951)
a scholar who writes explanatory notes on an author (especially an ancient commentator on a classical author)
a woman schoolteacher (especially one regarded as strict)
black tourmaline
French philosopher and physician and organist who spent most of his life as a medical missionary in Gabon (1875-1965)
a candle or flaming torch secured in a sconce
a decorative wall bracket for holding candles or other sources of light
a shelter or screen providing protection from enemy fire or from the weather
a small fort or earthwork defending a ford, pass, or castle gate
large black diving duck of northern parts of the northern hemisphere
a native or inhabitant of Scotland
United States general who was a hero of the War of 1812 and who defeated Santa Anna in the Mexican War (1786-1866)
United States slave who sued for liberty after living in a non-slave state; caused the Supreme Court to declare the Missouri Compromise unconstitutional (1795?-1858)
British author of historical novels and ballads (1771-1832)
award-winning United States film actor (1928-1999)
English explorer who reached the South Pole just a month after Amundsen; he and his party died on the return journey (1868-1912)
a lightweight motorcycle equipped with rugged tires and suspension; an off-road motorcycle designed for riding cross country or over unpaved ground
a rapid mover; someone who scrambles
examples: their quarterback was a good scrambler
scramblers can often unnerve a better tennis player

definitions.definition: electronic equipment that makes speech unintelligible during transmission and restores it at reception
any of various hand tools for scraping
protect, hide, or conceal from danger or harm
test or examine for the presence of disease or infection
examples: screen the blood for the HIV virus

definitions.definition: a strainer for separating lumps from powdered material or grading particles
a covering that serves to conceal or shelter something
examples: a screen of trees afforded privacy

definitions.definition: the personnel of the film industry
examples: a star of stage and screen

definitions.definition: separate with a riddle, as grain from chaff
examine in order to test suitability
examples: screen these samples
screen the job applicants

definitions.definition: a white or silvered surface where pictures can be projected for viewing
prevent from entering
the display that is electronically created on the surface of the large end of a cathode-ray tube
a protective covering that keeps things out or hinders sight
a protective covering consisting of netting; can be mounted in a frame
examples: they put screens in the windows for protection against insects
a metal screen protected the observers

definitions.definition: examine methodically
examples: screen the suitcases

definitions.definition: partition consisting of a decorative frame or panel that serves to divide a space
project onto a screen for viewing
examples: screen a film

definitions.definition: a firm open-weave fabric used for a curtain in the theater
